text: Thryptomene eremaea is a shrub species in the family Myrtaceae that is endemic to Western Australia. The erect and open shrub typically grows to a height of in height. It blooms between July and September producing white-pink flowers. It is found on sand plains in the Goldfields-Esperance region of Western Australia north of Kalgoorlie where it grows in sandy soils. ==References== eremaea Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia Category:Rosids of Western Australia Category:Vulnerable flora of Australia Category:Plants described in 2001 Category:Taxa named by Barbara Lynette Rye Category:Taxa named by Malcolm Eric Trudgen
title: Thryptomene eremaea
